#Day 10
Raunak Bhaiya, your journey from the first video to now is nothing short of magical. The way you've built up the confidence to take lifts from complete strangers on the road shows your fearless heart and pure intentions. You inspire us to step out of our comfort zones and trust the goodness in the world.

And a special salute to the incredible man in the video who, despite his disability, drives with such grace and a smile that lights up the screen. You reminded us that strength isn’t in the body, it’s in the spirit. You’re a true hero.

Love you Raunak Bhaiya (Monkey Magic ❤)

This isn't just a trip—it's an odyssey, a powerful testament to your resilience, determination, and spirit. Every kilometer you cover, every lift you get, every smile you share is creating ripples of positivity far beyond what you can see. You're inspiring thousands of hearts, Rounak. People watching your journey aren’t just viewers—they're fellow dreamers who find strength in your adventure. Even at this low point, remember you're not alone. Your viewers, your family, your friends—we’re all with you, cheering, hoping, and believing in your dream.
The toughest days of your journey are shaping you, testing your limits and revealing who you truly are. Hold onto this truth: the most meaningful adventures aren’t the ones without hurdles, but those where the hurdles teach you to fly higher.
You’re on a mission bigger than yourself. You're not just crossing a map; you're bridging lives, cultures, and stories. Push through this low moment because the sunrise waiting for you at the end of this journey will be unforgettable. It will illuminate not just the path behind you but also the infinite possibilities ahead.
Keep your heart brave, your spirit bright, and your dream alive. You've got this, Rounak—your magic is real. Stay strong, Your fans from Monkeymagic, who believe in you deeply! Lots of Love from my side
👍 Bro please continue the series when situation gets better, one of the best travel series on entire youtube.👍

Hi Raunak 
I've been thoroughly enjoying your Kashmir to Kanyakumari journey—what an amazing and engaging series! You've reached Pushkar Bypass and every episode so far has been a treat to watch. I understand you've taken a break, not only to rest but also considering the sensitive India-Pakistan situation, and I truly respect that. It’s wise and thoughtful of you. Your efforts have been incredible, and it's clear how much heart you’ve put into this journey. Take the time you need—your health and peace of mind come first. When things settle, I really hope you continue the series. It’s something many of us look forward to!

Bhaiya one suggestion please don't ask for free lift/food try to spend minimum amount that will save your time, for free stay you may choose any temple/railway station/Police station, you just have to focusing on earning money by clicking photos/shooting a documentary videos for publicity of any business/try to selling something in a public places
Show that everyone can travel in India for by spending a minimum amount of rupees if they want they can earn also while traveling
Please visit famous dargah of india which is in Ajmer called "Khwaja Gareeb Nawaz"
4:35 aik suggestion hai upar jaise real timing dikhate ho vaise pure video mai real timing dikhao

First of all, thank you so much for this lovely video ❣, it feels like I am watching a world's best short film (while writing this comment I don't know how to express it, but I will try my best) the kind of emotion in your eyes and face you portrayed is so overwhelming bhaiya while watching I had a feeling ki yeh video khatam hi naa ho , it feels like I am watching a small baby who is hungry and yet showing his dedication towards his dream. Around 12 am in the night I was watching Bawa bhaiya ka video he was sharing loss about his parents, till then I was not aware about the same, but the point here is that aap dono ki smile dekhkar sukun milta hai chahe aap log ke life mein kitni bhi badi problems ho, aap sabhi log ke vajah se we feel so good and forget all our pain, kahne ko tho bahot kuch hai but itna hi... love you bade bhaiya 💓💗 take care of your health , thanks for your storytelling and documenting your life , aapka london trip bahot achhe se jaye once you start and may god bless you with all beautiful memories and success only.
You definitely needed some downtime.  Glad it worked out

I also pondered what could be the purpose of this series. The real purpose will be revealed at the end, with all those memories of people who helped, unexpected act of kindness, that is to reveal how welcoming the people of India are. Despite this terrorism, the nation is united. 

That humanity still exist and will continue to flourish as long as we have love and compassion in our hearts. 

I've fair share of experiences where strangers helped in expected way. And I love to narrate those instances to others.Travelling can be daunting, yet it's freeing and eye-opening.
Too good Raunaq....You R so brave brother.... Keep it up....Be Safe 👍🙏. ... Happy Journey 🥰

Raunaq, seeing you walk through Pushkar and Ajmer honestly hits different, this is my hometown, and watching it be a part of my fav series on yt makes me feel emotions I can't express.
I’ve been following every single episode of this series like it’s my personal ritual. It’s more than just travel content for me; it’s hope, it’s humanity, it’s magic.
You’ve unknowingly become such a big part of my days. I don’t even know how to explain it properly, but I genuinely look up to you. You’re doing what so many of us only dream of; wandering, connecting, feeling.
I hope one day I get to meet you in real life and show you around the off beat areas of my place, to say thank you and maybe hear one of your stories in person. You’ve inspired me in ways I didn’t know I needed. Keep going, Raunaq. You’re changing lives in the gentlest way. Stay safe, much love to you!

My take on your videos - In India, you will find 1 out of 10 people of helping nature. If you tried this abroad, such things will be very difficult, even your favorite London.
.
Also, an average Indian can easily identify you as a person from a good family, so they won't mind helping you out. From your body, your dressing sense, your cameras, you look as upper middle class person to those who don't know you. That would be another advantage. In North and West India, when you talk in English to hotels/hostels or any other services, the language would give you an edge.
.
You look innocent. So, best wishes for your journey.
